project.teaser: The idea is to Build a Knowledge Base, that can be used to trace all activities related to the overall life-cycle of buildings. Since various directives of the EU are related to sustainability, resilience and energy efficiency of building stock, it is necessary to provide a...
project.objective: The idea is to Build a Knowledge Base, that can be used to trace all activities related to the overall life-cycle of buildings. Since various directives of the EU are related to sustainability, resilience and energy efficiency of building stock, it is necessary to provide a marketplace where various actors can share their offers, including their quality certificates and credentials, and where it would be possible to log and trace every information, activity and change, and use the knowledge to improve sustainability. The project will extend a Digital Building LogBook (DBL), used by a municipality for the management and the administration of its huge set of buildings, with several available and novel data, tools and functionalities, by the help of a Decentralized Knowledge Graph (DKG), an open source blockchain-based solution. DKG software will include specific building-related ontologies, so that the whole knowledge base about the life-cycle of the building can be logged and by that continuously updated, providing mechanisms and interfaces for the relevant stakeholders, to publish, trace, share, tokenize, end even trade models in a market economy. Such information integration can support decisions on optimal adaptation and intervention planning strategies for large populations of buildings. The DBL will be integrated with several new functionalities demonstrated on a dozen of use cases via easily accessible and publicly available APIs. These functionalities will assure a high interoperability between legacy systems and existing tools (e.g. BIM, HBIM), compliance with standards, providing automated warning and alerting system with the help of machine learning tools, digital twinning, and decision-making support. The new DBL based applications will be tested on pilot projects focusing on historical and critical buildings, and on building stocks. The project targets a smarter and more sustainable built environment of the EU providing new market and new value creation.
project.title: BUILDing knowledge book in the blockCHAIN distributed ledger. Trustworthy building life-cycle knowledge graph for sustainability and energy efficiency
project.keywords: Knowledge Graph, Decentralized, Digital Logbook, BIM, HBIM, Digitization, Resilience, Sustainability, Life-cycle, AI, Machine Learning, Energy efficiency, Marketplace, Bayesian Update, Digital Twin

article.title: Digital solution for improving building life cycle knowledge

result.title: Project Website and Collaborative Infrastructure
result.description: A website available for everyone interested in sharing and reusing the resources and technical platform including reports on the result, developed tools, mailing lists, wikis, social network accounts, etc.

result.title: Design of the BUILDCHAIN system
result.description: Report describing the new BUILDCHAIN design and its new features and tools presented on use cases with de-tailed interoperability possibilities, data collection and update tools, expected events and triggers and collects data types to be logged, and provides an initial reference architecture. All partners will contribute to the writing.

result.title: Modelling of Multi-Storey Cross-Laminated Timber Buildings for Vibration Serviceability

details.authors: Blaž Kurent; Noemi Friedman; Boštjan Brank

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Project management Plan
result.description: Project management plan including risk management strategy

result.title: Ontology and Decentralized Knowledge Graph Design for BUILDCHAIN
result.description: It contains the ontology of the BUILDCHAIN, and the architecture and detailed design of the Decentralized Knowledge Graph that will be used to contain the BUILDCHAIN. The cost of the data management operations in the decentralized knowledge graph will also be analyzed and presented in the deliverable.

result.title: Short Interim Management Report 1
result.description: Short interim management report about the achievements at month 6 of the project.

result.title: Short interim management report 2
result.description: Short interim management report about the achievements at month 12 of the project.

result.title: State-of-the-art analysis and project vision of the BUILDCHAIN system
result.description: Report summarizing the positioning of the BUILDCHAIN among related technologies, data formats and common languages, and research directions. It reviews the state of the art of DBL initiatives and tools building on it. All partners will contribute to the writing.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
